definition[0]: a way of achieving something more quickly than is normally done
example[0]: a young actress on the fast track to fame and success
definition[1]: the fast track to something is the fastest way of achieving it
example[1]: Many saw independence as the fast track to democracy.
definition[2]: happening or making progress more quickly than is usual
definition[3]: to help something happen or make progress more quickly than usual
example[3]: Your application can be fast-tracked for a fee.
definition[4]: a quick and direct path to getting jobs that are more important and better paid
example[4]: He is a middle manager in his 30s, on the fast track for promotion.
example[5]: one of the bankâ€™s fast track graduates
